Name.BusinessNameLine1: Our Lady of the Lake University of

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: AS A CATHOLIC UNIVERSITY SPONSORED BY THE SISTERS OF DIVINE PROVIDENCE, OUR LADY OF THE LAKE UNIVERSITY IS A COMMUNITY WHOSE MEMBERS ARE COMMITTED TO SERVE STUDENTS BY (SEE SCHEDULE O)
IRS990.MissionDescription: AS A CATHOLIC UNIVERSITY SPONSORED BY THE SISTERS OF DIVINE PROVIDENCE, OUR LADY OF THE LAKE UNIVERSITY IS A COMMUNITY WHOSE MEMBERS ARE COMMITTED TO SERVE STUDENTS BY: *ENSURING QUALITY, INNOVATIVE UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE LEARNING EXPERIENCES, *FOSTERING SPIRITUAL, PERSONAL, AND PROFESSIONAL GROWTH, AND *PREPARING STUDENTS FOR SUCCESS AND CONTINUED SERVICE.
IRS990.Description: OUR LADY OF THE LAKE UNIVERSITY IS AN EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION OF MORE THAN 2,600 STUDENTS. IN ADDITION TO VARIOUS DEGREE PROGRAMS, WE ALSO OPERATE UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE WEEKEND COLLEGES FOR WORKING ADULTS. WE HAVE APPROXIMATELY 500 BOARDING STUDENTS PER SEMESTER.

Form990PartVIISectionA.Title: VP OF ACADEMIC AFFAIRS/ PROF L

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: INVEST ENDOWMENT DONATIONS AND BOARD DESIGNATED FUNDS TO SUPPORT UNIVERSITY OPERATIONS AND STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS.

THE UNIVERSITY AND OLLU MAIN ARE EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(A) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (IRC) AS ORGANIZATIONS DESCRIBED IN IRC SECTION 501(C)(3) AND A SIMILAR PROVISION OF STATE LAW. HOWEVER, THE ENTITIES ARE SUBJECT TO FEDERAL INCOME TAX ON ANY UNRELATED BUSINESS TAXABLE INCOME. WITH A FEW EXCEPTIONS, THE UNIVERSITY IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL EXAMINATIONS BY TAX AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS BEFORE 2006.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: OTHER AMOUNTS INCLUDED ON LINE 1 BUT NOT ON FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 12
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: TUITION DISCOUNT NETTED WITH REVENUE FOR FORM 990 11,653,795 REVENUE RECORDED AS EXPENSE OFFSET 177,467 ------------ TOTAL TO PART XII, LINE 4B 22,166,022

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: OTHER AMOUNTS INCLUDED ON LINE 1 BUT NOT ON FORM 990, PART IX, LINE 25
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: TUITION DISCOUNT NETTED WITH REVENUE FOR FORM 990 11,653,795 REVENUE RECORDED AS EXPENSE OFFSET 177,467 MISCELLANEOUS (25) ---------- TOTAL TO PART XIII, LINE 4B 11,831,237

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: COLLECTIONS OF ART NOT REPORTED IN REVENUE STATEMENT AND BALANCE SHEET
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED MAY 31, 2009, OLLU RECEIVED A DONATION OF ARTWORK VALUED AT $93,000. THIS ARTWORK IS HELD BY OLLU FOR PUBLIC EXHIBITION; THEREFORE, THE ORGANIZATION ELECTED UNDER SFAS 116 NOT TO REPORT THE ARTWORK IN ITS REVENUE STATEMENT AND BALANCE SHEET. BECAUSE THIS AMOUNT IS IMMATERIAL, THERE IS NO FOOTNOTE INCLUDED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS RECEIVED FROM THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT. A COMPLETE LISTING OF FEDERAL GRANTS IS ON FILE AT OLLU AND IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. ALSO, PLEASE SEE A-133 SINGLE AUDIT REPORT.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.ReturnReference: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO U.S.
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: SCHOLARSHIP/DISCOUNTS ARE CREDITED TO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT MAINTAINED WITH OLLU.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: PER THE EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT, THE PRESIDENT, TESSA MARTINEZ POLLACK, PARTICIPATES IN AN IRC SECTION 457(B) PLAN. THE UNIVERSITY CONTRIBUTES 2% OF THE PRESIDENT'S BASE SALARY UP TO THE MAXIMUM AMOUNT PERMITTED BY THE IRC REGULATIONS INTO THIS DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN EACH CALENDAR YEAR. THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF THIS DEFERRAL FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED MAY 31, 2010 WAS $4,968.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE DRAFT OF FORM 990 IS PRESENTED TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND MADE AVAILABLE AT THE BOARD MEETING FOR ALL TRUSTEES TO REVIEW.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: PROCESS FOR MONITORING COMPLIANCE WITH CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS E-MAILED TO ALL TRUSTEES, OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES AND THE FORM IS SIGNED AND RETAINED BY THE UNIVERSITY.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: REVIEW OF CEO OR TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIAL COMPENSATION
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD REVIEWS THE SALARY FOR THE PRESIDENT AND REVIEWS COMPARABLE DATA FROM CUPA (COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION). SALARIES ARE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: REVIEW OF OTHER OFFICER OR KEY EMPLOYEES COMPENSATION
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD REVIEWS THE SALARIES FOR OFFICERS AND KEY FACULTY. THE COMPARABLE DATA INCLUDES CUPA DATA AND SAN ANTONIO SALARY SURVEYS. RESULTS AND RECOMMENDATIONS ARE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: DESCRIBE HOW DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ED CROSS AND MIKE EDELMAN HAVE A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP WITH EACH OTHER.

AS A CATHOLIC UNIVERSITY SPONSORED BY THE SISTERS OF DIVINE PROVIDENCE, OUR LADY OF THE LAKE UNIVERSITY IS A COMMUNITY WHOSE MEMBERS ARE COMMITTED TO SERVE STUDENTS BY: *ENSURING QUALITY, INNOVATIVE UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE LEARNING EXPERIENCES, *FOSTERING SPIRITUAL, PERSONAL, AND PROFESSIONAL GROWTH, AND *PREPARING STUDENTS FOR SUCCESS AND CONTINUED SERVICE.
